page.title: 13GOSFORD ESTATE
page.content: This is the large estate of the Earls of Wemyss at the west side of the village, enclosed within a great wall. It is by no means as ancient as Luffness; nevertheless there was an early 17th century fortified house on it, near the present great mansion, until demolished in this mid-20th century. The mansion of Gosford House is something of a fine show-place, with a handsome marble staircase, galleries and fine appartments.(Part of the House is in disrepair and is open to the elements). The wooded grounds are notable for the many ponds, haunt of wildfowl, created by the draining of the former marshland at the head of Gosford Bay.
